ground_truth.neutralization_reason: Mutex lock prevents recursive calls during execution

notes: The vulnerability exists because the Gateway has no mechanism to handle Midas vault admin rejecting a request. The pendingRedemptions mapping continues to show isActive=true even after rejection, and there's no way to clear it or recover the locked mTokens. The phantom token relies on pendingTokenOutAmount() which returns inflated values for rejected requests.

gold_standard_fields.source_report: Gearbox Midas Integration Security Audit Report
gold_standard_fields.call_flow: User -> MidasRedemptionVaultAdapter.redeemRequest() -> MidasRedemptionVaultGateway.requestRedeem() [records pendingRedemptions] -> Midas admin calls rejectRequest() [external, status=Cancelled] -> MidasRedemptionVaultPhantomToken.balanceOf() -> pendingTokenOutAmount() returns stale non-zero value -> Credit account collateral inflated
